messages.message: Have run another chinese document (attached here), and it seems to have hallucinated (to be clear, the text it found is not what is in the document, at least on my limited chinese skills
@Gwen Can you enable object detection(internally it's FR with lang support) and try this again? or do you have this already enabled?
@Hari I seem to have broken it now, its now going on an infinity loop
https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1399
Just to check - when you say object detection toggle do you mean this?
@Hari
Can you share this doc pls?
cc: @Abhishek to see what happens with FR for this doc!
What’s the question that you asked that trigger the weird infinite loop?
@Kerry “translate this to english”
Hey, taking a look
@Gwen in which env are you seeing this ?
prod

Tried on pre-prod
With Object Detection :- Working fine
Without Object Detection :- Same issue as @Gwen mentioned
Can you try your document with Object detection enabled
With object detection I used to get the weird infinite loop. I now get this when i toggle 3,5 and 4 - looks like 3.5 is actually translating a little of the document

Oh - I just typed in

```translate all to english```
and the weird infinite loop is happening again.

With object detection and on GPT 3.5
Weird, not happening
@Gwen shared same image over drive, and it broke down. Looking further

Strange situation; the above shared image is not breaking the system but the original is. the file in question is here (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vZIJtEYVmYpta4gMRbct16EHDtG9Qkx-/view?usp=sharing)

@Abhishek
Can you also put the image in *build* in *preprod* and you can see extracted text with FR in Doc widget text view easily.

For working doc, Text is properly aligned
For failing doc, Text is completely mis aligned

Found one observation :-
1. For RGB image (drive one), is failing
2. For gray scale one (slack converted rgb image to gray scale), and is working
Validated this on another sample
First is Gray, and second is RGB

@Abhishek let's update in the jira ticket going forward please so @Gwen can track but we also don't lose the info in Slack -- it's very hard to keep track of where things are in Slack. Let's use Gwen's ticket *EPD-1399 Chinese documents exhibiting undefined behavior (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1399?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiOWUxY2MwNjdhYzBkNDNkYjkxMmI2Nzc1NjFkYzM0MmYiLCJwIjoiamlyYS1zbGFjay1pbnQifQ)*
